intro: Pedicularis caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or mountainous areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred petal that attracts pollinators. It is characterized by its erect stem and lance-shaped leaves, and it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native environment.
